reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: World Wide Fund for Nature Finland

description.narrative: Rights responsibilities and resources - preserving nature for the well-being of future generationsThe programmatic compoments under the partnership are divided into:1. Programme compoments delivered by the WWF partenr organizations and WWF partner programm es in the Global South,2. Programme components undertaken by WWF Finland office and mainly also delivered in Finland but in strong and constant cooperation with partner countries. These programme components are so-called thematic components and include: e cological footprint, environmental education, communication, and illegal wildlife trade. The programme components in selected target areas include three geographic regions: 1) Coastal East Africa 2) the Himalayas 3) Borneo. The issues that the programme wi ll focus on called work areas are: a) Sustainable natural resouce management and biodiversity conservation b) Climate change mitigation and adaptation c) Ecological footprint d) Strenghtening civil cociety e) Reducing poverty and inequalityf) Species conse rvationg) Green economy h) Illegal wildlife trad ei) fisheries.
